content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #226

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Is there a need to distinguish subscrbing applications?

Submitted by Greg Staudenmaier on behalf of @IoanaSingureanu (ioana.singureanu@bookzurman.com )
Chapter/section:
Url:
Type: A-Q
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary: Is there a need to distinguish subscrbing applications?

Comment: Is there a need to distinguish between driving and syncrhonizing applications? Should all application syncrhonize on all events/hub.topics they subscribed? WebSub doesn't make this distinction and neither did CCOW.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

Chapter/section:
Url:
Type: A-Q
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary: Is there a need to distinguish subscrbing applications?

Comment: Is there a need to distinguish between driving and syncrhonizing applications? Should all application syncrhonize on all events/hub.topics they subscribed? WebSub doesn't make this distinction and neither did CCOW.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

NiklasSvenzen commented on Issue #226

During conversation at the Montreal, May 2019 working group meeting, @wdvr, @wmaethner, @NiklasSvenzen and myself talked through this issue and would like to propose:

Proposed resolution: Persusasive with mod
Remove "driving application" and reword.

Existing wording: The app MUST either be launched from the driving application following the SMART on FHIR EHR launch flow or the app may initiate the launch following the SMART on FHIR standalone launch. In either case, the app MUST request and be granted the fhircast OAuth2.0 scope.

Proposed wording: Following a SMART on FHIR EHR launch or SMART standalone launch, the app SHALL request and if authorized, SHALL be granted the fhircast OAuth 2.0 scope.

NiklasSvenzen labeled Issue #226

wmaethner commented on Issue #226

## Montreal May 2019 Working Group Vote

Niklas Svenzen moved the following disposition, seconded by Isaac Vetter

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: Use proposed wording: Following a SMART on FHIR EHR launch or SMART standalone launch, the app SHALL request and if authorized, SHALL be granted the fhircast OAuth 2.0 scope.

:+1: For: 12
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
